No menos inquietante que el punto anterior es la posibilidad de que una inteligencia artificial (IA) nos gobierne. Dinamarca abri√≥ el debate en sus √∫ltimas elecciones legislativas, a las que concurri√≥ el Partido Sint√©tico liderado por una IA, un chatbot llamado Leader Lars, con la aspiraci√≥n de entrar en el parlamento. Detr√°s del chatbot hay humanos, naturalmente, en particular la fundaci√≥n MindFuture de arte y tecnolog√≠a.  Leader Lars fue entrenado con los programas electorales de partidos daneses marginales desde 1970 para configurar una propuesta que representara al 20 % de la poblaci√≥n danesa que no acude a las urnas.  Si bien el Partido Sint√©tico parece una extravagancia ‚Äîcon propuestas tan atrevidas como una renta b√°sica universal superior a 13 400 ‚Ç¨ al mes, el doble del salario medio en Dinamarca‚Äî, ha servido para estimular el debate sobre la capacidad de una inteligencia artificial para gobernarnos. ¬øPuede realmente una IA contempor√°nea, bien entrenada y con suficientes recursos, gobernarnos?  Si analizamos el pasado reciente de la inteligencia artificial, vemos que los avances se suceden uno tras otro a velocidad de v√©rtigo, particularmente en el campo del procesamiento del lenguaje natural tras la aparici√≥n de las arquitecturas basadas en transformers. Se tratan de enormes redes neuronales artificiales entrenadas para aprender a generar textos, pero f√°cilmente adaptables a muchas otras tareas. De alguna manera, estas redes aprenden la estructura general del lenguaje humano y acaban teniendo un conocimiento del mundo a trav√©s de lo que han ‚Äúle√≠do‚Äù.

Uno de los ejemplos m√°s avanzados y espectaculares lo ha desarrollado OpenAI y se llama ChatGPT. Se trata de un chatbot capaz de responder de manera coherente a casi cualquier pregunta formulada en lenguaje natural, de generar texto o de efectuar tareas tan complicadas como escribir programas inform√°ticos a partir de unas pocas indicaciones.  Las ventajas de usar una IA para la acci√≥n de gobierno ser√≠an varias. Por una parte, su capacidad de procesar datos y conocimiento para la toma de decisiones es muy superior a la de cualquier humano. Tambi√©n estar√≠a libre (en principio) del fen√≥meno de la corrupci√≥n y no le influir√≠an los intereses personales.  Pero, a d√≠a de hoy, los chatbots s√≥lo reaccionan, se alimentan de la informaci√≥n que alguien les proporciona y dan respuestas. No son realmente libres de pensar ‚Äúespont√°neamente‚Äù, de tomar la iniciativa. Es m√°s adecuado ver estos sistemas como or√°culos, capaces de responder a preguntas del tipo ‚Äúqu√© crees que pasar√≠a si‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äúque propondr√≠as en caso de‚Ä¶‚Äù, m√°s que como agentes activos o controladores.  Los posibles problemas y peligros de este tipo de inteligencias, basadas en grandes redes neuronales han sido analizados en numerosos estudios cient√≠ficos. Un problema fundamental es el de la falta de transparencia (‚Äúexplicabilidad‚Äù) de las decisiones que toman. En general act√∫an como ‚Äúcajas negras‚Äù sin que podamos saber qu√© razonamiento han llevado a cabo para llegar a una conclusi√≥n.

Y no olvidemos que detr√°s de la m√°quina est√°n los humanos, que han podido introducir ciertos sesgos (consciente o inconscientemente) en la IA a trav√©s de los textos que han usado para entrenarla. Por otro lado, la IA no est√° libre de dar datos o consejos err√≥neos, como muchos usuarios de ChatGPT han podido experimentar.  Los avances tecnol√≥gicos permiten vislumbrar una futura IA capaz de ‚Äúgobernarnos‚Äù, por el momento no sin el imprescindible control humano. El debate deber√≠a moverse pronto del plano t√©cnico al plano √©tico y social. Este art√≠culo fue publicado originalmente en The Conversation. Lea el original. Recibe cada ma√±ana nuestra newsletter. Una gu√≠a para entender  lo que importa en relaci√≥n con la tecnolog√≠a, la ciencia y la cultura digital.

Share  Copied The Synthetic Party's AI-driven chatbot is just one feature of Denmark's only party whose policies are derived from artificial intelligence./James Brooks/AFP Universal basic income that's double the average wage? Legislating in favor of human-algorithmic coexistence? These are just some of the policies to come out of Denmark's first political party to have its election platform designed by artificial intelligence (AI).  The Synthetic Party, which hopes to run in the country's general election next year, was launched in May by the artists' collective Computer Lars in the aim of reaching around 15 percent of Danes who did not vote in the previous election in 2019. The party says the unpersuaded voters did not exercise their right to because none of the traditional parties appealed to them.   READ MORE The story of a Mariupol survivor Fulfilling a promise‚Ä¶ 1,500 years late Swimming in Odesa's catacombs   Using AI to analyze all of Denmark's fringe parties' written publications since 1970, the Synthetic Party's program has developed a manifesto that it believes represents "the political visions of the everyday person," according to Asker Bryld Staunaes, one of the members of the collective,  The party "takes its departure in an analysis of optimizing the voting system in Denmark," he said. It is also a cheeky retort to the hundreds of small parties that have been set up over the years, many of which are based more on parodying politics or critizising society than implementing policy. Denmark currently has 230 micro-parties, including the Synthetics. "It's a way to mimic and simulate the political process throughout but in a direct confrontation of the apparatus of lawmaking and political enforcement and organisation rights," Bryld Staunaes said. The party's proposals include the introduction of a universal basic income of 100,000 kroner ($13,700) a month, which is more than double the average Danish salary. The Synthetic also supports a new 18th UN sustainable development goal that would allow "humans and algorithms to coexist more directly than now," Bryld Staunaes said. Party member Asker Bryld Staunaes believes humans and algorithms should communicate more closely.  /James Brooks/AFP Whether the party will gain enough traction to actually take part in next year's poll remains to be seen: in Denmark, parties need 20,182 signatures to appear on ballots, and the Synthetics currently have just four, according to official election data. But if it does manage to win a parliamentary seat, it plans to use its powers to push for closer connections between AI and the work being done by assembly members. "The idea... is to take this huge political and economic force (algorithms)... to try to inscribe it into the traditional political system," Bryld Staunaes said. Right now, "we have no way of actually addressing humans and AI within a democratic setting", he added. People can "talk" directly with the party's AI on messaging platform Discord via chatbots, with party plans to launch its first election rally "for a human audience" in September. It's not the first time an AI-based political movement has sprung up around the world.  In 2018, Japan became home to the world's first AI candidate for mayor, Michihito Matsuda, who reportedly came third.

A estas alturas de la pel√≠cula, con la inteligencia artificial (IA) creando arte, m√∫sica y cr√≥nicas, dirigiendo barcos y aviones, elaborando deepfakes que ponen a prueba la m√°s avezada de las vistas y pasando casi por humana ‚Äîo sin el casi, eso depende de a qui√©n se pregunte‚Äî, la cuesti√≥n parece bastante pertinente: ¬øpor qu√© no dejar que marque el rumbo de los gobiernos? Suena estrafalario, pero en el Reino de Dinamarca hay quien cree que ser√≠a una idea b√°rbara. Tanto, de hecho, que ya ha puesto en marcha la maquinaria administrativa para conseguirlo.  A finales de mayo el colectivo de artistas Computer Lars lanz√≥ Det Syntetiske Parti, que traducido al espa√±ol equivaldr√≠a a El partido Sint√©tico. El nombre puede resultar un tanto cr√≠ptico, pero capta parte de la esencia de la formaci√≥n danesa: su car√°cter artificial y su esfuerzo por sintetizar ideas, algo que ha logrado echando mano precisamente de las posibilidades que ofrece la IA. La clave de la formaci√≥n est√° en su programa. Para elaborarlo sus impulsores han recabado las propuestas de los "micropartidos" surgidos en el pa√≠s a lo largo del √∫ltimo medio siglo ‚Äîse han remontado a 1970‚Äî y las han analizado con IA. El resultado, recalca uno de sus impulsores, Asker Bryld Staunaes, es una propuesta que engloba ‚Äúlas visiones pol√≠ticas de la persona com√∫n‚Äù. Por lo pronto la formaci√≥n permite que el p√∫blico pueda interactuar con su IA a trav√©s de un chatbot en Discord, donde tambi√©n pude contactar con sus responsables. ‚ÄúIntenta ampliar el imaginario sobre c√≥mo podemos trabajar juntos de una mejor manera‚Äù, comenta Staunaes a la cadena TRT World. Uno de los objetivos que se marca la formaci√≥n, de hecho, es sumar un nuevo objetivo de desarrollo sostenible a la lista ya elaborada por la Organizaci√≥n de Naciones Unidas: lograr una coexistencia ‚Äúm√°s directa‚Äù entre los algoritmos y humanos. ‚ÄúSomos un partido antipol√≠tico que pretende implantar la ‚ÄòLife With Artificials‚Äô como el 18¬∫ de los objetivos de desarrollo sostenible de la ONU‚Äù, explica la formaci√≥n, y zanja: ‚Äúqueremos acabar con los pol√≠ticos grises y blancos que no bastan para crear la Dinamarca que nuestros hijos merecen‚Äù. Detr√°s de la propuesta ‚Äîdesliza Staunaes‚Äî habr√≠a tambi√©n una respuesta ir√≥nica a los cientos de partidos marginales creados a lo largo de los a√±os en Dinamarca y que en ocasiones se plantean m√°s a modo de cr√≠tica social que de aut√©ntica plataforma desde la que impulsar pol√≠ticas. stiftendk: 165 partier samler v√¶lgererkl√¶ringer - Det Syntetiske Parti fra Aarhus er √©t af dem: - Vores parti er ikke for sjov https://t.co/QV2iuoYNyn‚Äî √ÖrhusPortal (@AarhusPortaldk) July 3, 2022  stiftendk: 165 partier samler v√¶lgererkl√¶ringer - Det Syntetiske Parti fra Aarhus er √©t af dem: - Vores parti er ikke for sjov https://t.co/QV2iuoYNyn Algunas de las propuestas elaboradas por el Partido Sint√©tico, de hecho, parecen muy dif√≠ciles de llevar a la pr√°ctica. Entre sus planteamientos destaca la creaci√≥n de una renta b√°sica universal que supondr√≠a m√°s del doble del salario medio del pa√≠s. Otra pasar√≠a por establecer una suerte de ‚Äúloter√≠a‚Äù con inteligencia artificial que cada mes permitir√≠a reemplazar de forma aleatoria a los integrantes del parlamento por ciudadanos, una suerte de ‚Äúlotocracia‚Äù con algoritmos.  ‚ÄúLa IA sabe que muchos de estos micropartidos hablan de democracia directa y est√°n cansados de la representativa ‚Äîdetalla Staunaes a la cadena TRT World‚Äî. El sistema occidental no funciona realmente tras el colapso del discurso p√∫blico en la era de los algoritmos de las redes‚Äù. Computer Lars no lo tendr√° f√°cil en cualquier caso para llevar sus ideas de la teor√≠a a la pr√°ctica. Antes necesitar√° las casi 20.200 firmas que la legislaci√≥n exige a los partidos para concurrir a las elecciones parlamentarias, marca de la que estar√≠a muy, muy lejos todav√≠a. Eso no quita que el objetivo est√© bien definido y el calendario ya trazado: el Partido Sint√©tico de Dinamarca quiere presentarse a las elecciones generales de junio de 2023 y arrastrar al 20% del electorado que, asegura, no acude a las urnas. ‚ÄúEl Partido Sint√©tico activa a los votantes de sof√° antipol√≠ticos‚Äù, remarca. De funcionarle la estrategia, el premio no ser√≠a menor: el porcentaje de participaci√≥n en la cita de 2019 fue del 84,5%, lo que deja un buen caladero de votantes. Si ara√±a al menos un esca√±o asegura que no se quedar√° de brazos cruzados y aprovechar√° el mandato para reforzar el peso de la inteligencia artificial en los debates parlamentarios. La iniciativa de Computer Lar no es la √∫nica ni la primera que ha querido maridar IA y pol√≠tica. Cuando en 2018 los vecinos del distrito de Tama, en Jap√≥n, tuvieron que votar a su nuevo dirigente local se encontraron con que uno de los candidatos era una IA, un robot llamado Michihito Matsuda que aseguraba que luchar√≠a para acabar con la corrupci√≥n. En la segunda vuelta qued√≥ tercero. En Rusia o Nueva Zelanda se han encontrado con sorpresas similares. Ahora Dinamarca podr√≠a ir un paso m√°s all√° en ese empe√±o. Por lo pronto el Partido Sint√©tico programa ya sus m√≠tines.

Programas   Podcast  Noticias   Deportes   Emisoras   ondacero.es  Madrid | 29.10.2022 10:47  La inteligencia artificial est√° presente en la educaci√≥n, sanidad, arte, transporte o log√≠stica. Cogemos el tel√©fono m√≥vil y est√° funcionando. Pero, ¬øy en pol√≠tica? Suena a ciencia ficci√≥n, pero es una realidad. En Dinamarca, ya existe un partido pol√≠tico dirigido por una inteligencia artificial y su l√≠der es un chatbot, es decir, un robot con el que cualquier ciudadano puede hablar. Este partido se llama ‚ÄòPartido sint√©tico‚Äô, est√° liderado por Leader Lars y participa en la actual campa√±a electoral, aunque eso s√≠, no va a presentar candidatos a los comicios al menos hasta 2023. Su objetivo es captar a los daneses que normalmente se abstienen de votar en las elecciones y poner a la tecnolog√≠a en el centro del debate pol√≠tico. Por ello, en Por fin no es lunes hablamos con Raquel Jorge Ricart, soci√≥loga y polit√≥loga del Real Instituto Elcano especializada en prospectiva y pol√≠tica tecnol√≥gica y digital, que explica que ‚Äúel uso de la inteligencia artificial en pol√≠tica es un tema muy sensible porque tiene incidencia en varios sentidos‚Äù. Por ejemplo: la cantidad de datos a los que tiene que tener acceso para que sepa tomar decisiones pol√≠ticas de alto calado; la importancia de la diversidad de grupos que existen o los riesgos que hay en materia de sesgos, emociones, etc. Todas estas variantes han llevado a la conclusi√≥n de que quiz√°s ‚Äúel uso de la inteligencia artificial a la hora de tomar decisiones pol√≠ticas no es lo m√°s correcto ni lo m√°s oportuno, porque al final es un soporte, una tecnolog√≠a que apoya a otras decisiones tomadas por personas humanas‚Äù. La inteligencia artificial es algo muy √∫til a la hora de realizar determinadas consultas o preguntas para poder saber qu√© tipo de pol√≠ticas son mejores para un lugar determinado, pero no siempre todo tipo de pregunta y filtro de datos tiene su oportunidad: ‚ÄúLa UE -con todos los partidos de acuerdo- han definido unos niveles de riesgo para el uso de esa inteligencia artificial‚Äù. Aunque reconoce que no es un tema que tenga mucho recorrido a√∫n, s√≠ que pone como ejemplo el uso de plataformas de participaci√≥n p√∫blica online que ya se usan en muchas regiones del mundo, como Barcelona, donde el Ayuntamiento ha facilitado un espacio online donde la gente puede subir sus opiniones, votar refer√©ndums o cuestionarios sobre gesti√≥n local. ‚ÄúDespu√©s, hay otro ejemplo, que no tiene nada que ver con la inteligencia artificial, pero s√≠ con la tecnolog√≠a m√°s emergente: Blockchain, que son los DAOs (Organizaciones aut√≥nomas descentralizadas). Gente que tiene criptomonedas dirigidas por Blockchain que se ponen de acuerdo para tomar decisiones m√°s orientadas a la pol√≠tica‚Äù, asegura. S√≠, ya que esta ser√° definida previamente por los seres humanos que le den los datos de los que se nutra: ‚ÄúParte de unos datos para que realmente pueda entender la complejidad y lo diverso que puede ser un pa√≠s o una sociedad. La IA se nutre de s√≠ misma con todos los est√≠mulos e inputs que le vas incorporando. De ah√≠ tambi√©n la importancia de que la gente que la est√© dise√±ando, sea capaz de hacerle entender lo que puede ser un discurso de odio‚Äù. "Estimados se√±ores y se√±oras diputados, Me dirijo a esta honorable asamblea para presentar una moci√≥n de censura contra el actual presidente del Gobierno, Pedro S√°nchez. Como economista, he estudiado detenidamente la situaci√≥n econ√≥mica del pa√≠s y he llegado a la conclusi√≥n de que la gesti√≥n econ√≥mica del actual Gobierno ha sido desastrosa. El se√±or S√°nchez ha prometido una serie de medidas para mejorar la econom√≠a del pa√≠s, pero desafortunadamente ha sido incapaz de cumplirlas. La tasa de desempleo sigue siendo extremadamente alta y la econom√≠a est√° en una situaci√≥n de estancamiento". As√≠ empezar√≠a el discurso de Ram√≥n Tamames si lo hubiese escrito una inteligencia artificial. En concreto, ChatGPT ha tardado menos de cinco segundos en hacerlo, siguiendo un comando tan sencillo como ‚Äúescribe un discurso de unas 700 palabras para una moci√≥n de censura contra Pedro S√°nchez como si fueras Ram√≥n Tamames‚Äù. No es un discurso excesivamente profundo, pero s√≠ acertado en su planteamiento, y en el estilo. Como suelen hacer los pol√≠ticos en el Congreso, se dirige al presidente del Gobierno como ‚Äúse√±or S√°nchez‚Äù y encabeza y cierra su locuci√≥n con las formas adecuadas, fiel a las maneras de la C√°mara Baja. He llegado a la conclusi√≥n de que la gesti√≥n econ√≥mica del actual Gobierno ha sido desastrosa Y es que, lo creamos o no, la inteligencia artificial est√° llamada a jugar un papel muy importante en la pol√≠tica del siglo XXI. Ya hay precedentes en Jap√≥n, Corea y Dinamarca. En el pa√≠s del sol naciente, un robot llamado Michihito Matsuda se present√≥ en 2018 a las elecciones de un distrito de Tokyo, con la promesa de acabar con la corrupci√≥n. Qued√≥ en tercera posici√≥n. En Corea del Sur han empleado tecnolog√≠a deep-fake para transformar un candidato de mediana edad en un avatar digital atractivo para los votantes j√≥venes. Mientras, en Dinamarca, el Partido Sint√©tico, liderado por una inteligencia artificial, ha elaborado un programa pol√≠tico con el objetivo de atraer al 20% de las personas que no suelen ir a votar en las elecciones. Son ejemplos anecd√≥ticos- no tanto en el caso dan√©s- pero que sirven como anticipo para vislumbrar lo que puede suponer la irrupci√≥n de la inteligencia artificial en el escenario pol√≠tico. ¬øAyuda para responder las preguntas parlamentarias? Eso es algo que ya puede hacer hoy mismo ChatGPT de manera gratuita. La IA que est√° asombrando al mundo tiene algunas limitaciones. Como anticipar escenarios futuros, pues se nutre de lo que ya se ha escrito y se ha plasmado en Internet con anterioridad. Pero es bien capaz de responder preguntas y recopilar informaci√≥n, en tiempo r√©cord. Puede y debe ser una gran ayuda para los asesores parlamentarios. ¬øY para los speech writers? Este trabajo, que existe al menos desde el a√±o 1920, podr√≠a estar en riesgo de desaparici√≥n si la inteligencia artificial sigue afilando su ingenio. Porque a capacidad de recopilar y ordenar informaci√≥n no tiene nada que envidiar a los seres humanos. De hecho, sin ponernos por ello demasiado apocal√≠pticos, podemos decir que ya los supera. En Corea del Sur han empleado tecnolog√≠a deep-fake para transformar un candidato de mediana edad en un avatar digital atractivo para los votantes j√≥venes ChatGPT es m√°s r√°pida y m√°s eficiente que cualquier escritor de discursos, aunque no tan brillante. The Synthetic Party is a new political group in Denmark that is led by an AI entity known as Leader Lars. Founded in May by artist collective Computer lars and non-profit

art and tech organisation MindFuture Foundation, the new political party is dedicated to following the policies of an AI programmed on all the policies of Danish fringe parties since the 1970s that have never managed to get a seat in the Parliament. Apart from promoting the presence of AI in politics, the Synthetic Party also aims to become an alternative for the 20 per cent of the Danish population that never votes in elections. But with only 11 signatures out of the 20,000 required to make it eligible to run in November‚Äôs election, it most likely won‚Äôt make the cut.

Viernes 10 de Marzo de 2023 Aunque la posibilidad de una IA liderando un partido pol√≠tico pueda parecer imposible desde el punto de vista √©tico, pol√≠tico y jur√≠dico, existes cuestiones que deberemos abordar antes de que esta idea pueda ser considerada como una opci√≥n viable. El Partido Sint√©tico, en Dinamarca, cuyo representante y l√≠der es un Chatbot, artificialmente inteligente, llamado ‚ÄúLeader Lars‚Äù, mediante pol√≠ticas derivadas de la IA, busca ser la voz de los ciudadanos que no se sienten representados por los partidos pol√≠ticos tradicionales e impulsa un esca√±o en el parlamento dan√©s. El objetivo de este partido es atraer a los ciudadanos que normalmente se abstienen de votar y poner la tecnolog√≠a en el centro del debate pol√≠tico. El creador del partido, Asker Staunaes, asegura que la inteligencia artificial tiene como objetivo dar voz a los partidos minoritarios y elaborar un programa electoral que atraiga a personas que no se han sentido atra√≠das por los programas de los partidos actuales. El Partido Sint√©tico tiene como meta formar parte del parlamento dan√©s mediante una IA que no roba, ni conspira, ni recibe sobornos y es inmune a las presiones. Su Leader Lars busca crear conciencia sobre el papel de la IA en nuestra vida y su posible intervenci√≥n en temas pol√≠ticos cotidianos, por otro lado, es capaz de ofrecer propuestas y argumentar en base a la situaci√≥n actual para convencer a los votantes, en tanto ya ha planteado una renta b√°sica equivalente a 13.700 d√≥lares al mes para los ciudadanos, previo estudio de factibilidad para obtenci√≥n de estos recursos. Dada la creciente complejidad de nuestras sociedades y las dificultades que presentan las instituciones pol√≠ticas para abordar las nuevas problem√°ticas contempor√°neas, se generan importantes s√≠ntomas de frustraci√≥n en la ciudadan√≠a, con altos niveles de desconfianza en el sistema democr√°tico y en la pol√≠tica en general. Surge entonces la inevitable pregunta, ¬øUna inteligencia artificial puede dirigir un pa√≠s? La idea de una inteligencia artificial neutra y con informaci√≥n perfecta, genera la falsa ilusi√≥n de la resoluci√≥n tecnol√≥gica de todos los conflictos. Sin embargo, estamos de hecho, en buena medida, gobernados algor√≠tmicamente. Cuestiones como la regulaci√≥n del tr√°fico, la concesi√≥n de un cr√©dito, la medici√≥n de los impactos y muchas medidas administrativas est√°n mediadas por algoritmos. Frente a estas cuestiones es importante tener en cuenta, en primer lugar, que nuestra legislaci√≥n actual no permitir√≠a en principio, que una IA ocupe un cargo pol√≠tico o tenga la capacidad de tomar decisiones importantes sin supervisi√≥n humana, cabe aclarar que, en el Partido Sint√©tico referenciado, los representantes a ocupar cargos legislativos ser√°n humanos, pero llevar√°n las propuestas de su Leader Lars. Es necesario por lo tanto tener una abordaje jur√≠dico integral de estas cuestiones. En segundo lugar, para que una IA pueda liderar, se requiere que est√© programada con una √©tica clara y consistente que asegure la toma de decisiones justas y equitativas, evitando sesgos y discriminaci√≥n. Sin embargo, aunque la IA puede procesar grandes cantidades de datos y realizar an√°lisis complejos, hay cuestiones pol√≠ticas que requieren consideraciones √©ticas, morales y juicio humano, que no pueden ser codificadas en un algoritmo. Por √∫ltimo, es importante destacar que la IA no debe ser vista como una amenaza para la democracia representativa, sino como una herramienta que puede ser utilizada de manera complementaria. De acuerdo con la profesora Mart√≠nez, Si el objetivo de la inteligencia artificial es imitar, copiar o incluso superar las caracter√≠sticas de la inteligencia humana, el modelo que se utiliza siempre ser√° el modelo humano, y este modelo no es neutral en la toma de decisiones. Por lo tanto, mientras se utilice el modelo humano como base, no ser√° posible lograr una inteligencia artificial neutral, ya que los humanos no lo somos. En definitiva, la IA tiene un papel importante que desempe√±ar en la pol√≠tica y la sociedad, pero debemos asegurarnos de que sea utilizada de manera responsable y √©tica, especialmente en estos contextos pol√≠ticos y sociales, por tanto, en lugar de delegar en la IA la posibilidad de decidir, debemos trabajar juntos para abordar las problem√°ticas actuales y complementar el proceso democr√°tico en lugar de sustituirlo. Solo de esta manera podemos aprovechar todo el potencial de la IA sin comprometer los valores fundamentales de nuestra sociedad. *Abogada, MBA en Gesti√≥n de Empresas de Industrias Creativas y Cultura, Especialista en Derecho de Autor, Fintech y Blockchain. Graham Norton has deleted his Twitter account, apparently (because he hasn‚Äôt commented on it) after seeing the responses, on Twitter, to his remarks during an interview with Mariella Frostrup at the Cheltenham Literature Festival. What got clipped off the front of most of the coverage was that the remarks came well into an hour-long interview, ostensibly about his new book (Forever Home; I‚Äôm told it‚Äôs good). Frostrup is on her last question, after what has been a very enjoyable discussion, before opening up to questions from the floor. Frostrup: It‚Äôs almost impossible to find anyone with a bad word to say about you. But‚Ä¶ people did get a bit upset about JK Rowling and you having her on Virgin [Radio]1. Do you think about cancel culture in any great shape or form, because the other thing I was struck about when I was in Ireland very recently was that it almost doesn‚Äôt exist there, because Irish people just talk, you know. And they can talk about anything and nothing. And that‚Äôs not to say that terrible things haven‚Äôt happened in Ireland, as we know, whether with the church or with the Troubles. But there is a sense that nothing is off-limits, so long as you go about it in the right way, maybe that‚Äôs the thing.. Norton: Maybe, I don‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs interesting‚Ä¶ Here he launched into the remarks that got clipped and turned into a thousand articles: ‚ÄúYou read a lot of articles in papers by people complaining about cancel culture and you think, in what world are you cancelled? I'm reading your article in a newspaper [Frostrup laughs], or you're doing interviews about how terrible it is to be cancelled? I think the word is the wrong word. I think the word should be accountability. John Cleese has been very public recently about, complaining about ‚Äòwhat you can say‚Äô, and I just think it must be very hard to be a man of a certain age, who's been able to say whatever you like for years, and now suddenly, there's some accountability there. It's, it‚Äôs, it‚Äôs free speech, but not consequence free. I‚Äôm aware of the things I say‚Äî Frostrup: I am, usually after the event, and then *boom*. But what about then‚Äîthat‚Äôs a very easy target, middle-aged man who‚Äôs used to saying what he wants, ruled the world, mansplains everywhere he goes, etc etc. But for example, JK Rowling for example then, that‚Äôs harder to make a point with, when you see someone expressing what may or may not be popular opinions, but to be deluged with that kind of anger, rage and attempts at censorship‚Äîthat seems to me more than just a middle aged man who wants to say what he used to say in the days of empire. Norton: What I feel is weird about this is that when I‚Äôm asked about it, I become part of the discussion. (Frostrup: I know, that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm wondering.) All I‚Äôm painfully aware of is that my voice adds nothing to that discussion, and I‚Äôm sort of embarrassed that I‚Äôm somehow drawn into it. And if people want to shine a light on those issues, and I hope people do, then talk to trans people, talk to the parents of trans kids, talk to doctors, talk to psychiatrists, talk to someone who can illuminate this in some way. I‚Äôm very aware that as Bloke Off The Telly, your voice can be artificially amplified. And once in a blue moon that can be good, but most of the time it‚Äôs a distraction. It‚Äôs for clicks: you can put my name in a headline‚ÄîGraham Norton slams, Graham Norton defends, Graham Norton weighs in on, and actaully Graham Norton shouldn‚Äôt be in your headline.  If you want to talk about something, talk about The Thing. You don‚Äôt need to attach a Kardashian or whatever to a serious subject. The subject should be enough in itself. It‚Äôs that Michael Gove thing about ‚Äúwe‚Äôve had enough of experts‚Äù. No, please can we have some experts! Please can we rustle up some experts and talk to them, rather than Man in Shiny Pink Suit2.‚Äù This all reads very sensibl,y but was not, as you‚Äôll guess, anything like the end of it. Billy Bragg agreed with Norton on Twitter, which prompted JK Rowling herself to respond:   You could read this as being said in a jokey fashion, or sardonically, or really angry irony. What didn‚Äôt happen was that everyone relaxed. No, as you‚Äôd expect, given that Rowling has 13 million followers compared to Bragg‚Äôs 322,000 (and Norton‚Äôs, then, 1.4 million), this prompted a blizzard of angry tweets back and forth between the standing armies of pro-trans and pro-Rowling tweeters (even though I don‚Äôt see those two groups as being exactly in opposition). At some point Norton appears to have decided he‚Äôd had enough. He doesn‚Äôt seem to have responded to any requests for comment, which makes sense given his remarks about about not wanting to be Bloke Off The Telly with an opinion: it would just become GRAHAM NORTON BREAKS SILENCE OVER TWITTER DELETION.  The whole spectacle is ultimately depressing‚ÄîNorton is an amazing TV and radio presence, even if his Twitter presence was pretty milquetoast. This prompted a tweet thread from Adam Tinworth, who lectures in Audience Strategy at the University of London‚Äôs department of Journalism. Here‚Äôs the full text of the thread (which I‚Äôve used, with attribution, with Adam‚Äôs permission; you‚Äôll realise why I asked permission first rather than just grabbing it as one normally does with Twitter threads). ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs depressing to see another public figure driven from Twitter for the crime of trying to find a tactful answer to the impossible ‚ÄúCC‚Äù question. There is no answer to that question that does not get at least one group of highly online, highly ideological people angry at you. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs becoming a totemic issue to the degree that I‚Äôm not even using the phrase in my thread because I know from experience that there are people searching for the term, who will happily sealion into the conversation.  ‚ÄúThe reality, of course, is that it‚Äôs all about power. Public social media, like Twitter, like Facebook, delivered highly organised ideological groups extreme power to make other people‚Äôs lives difficult. Sometimes this is good. Sometimes this is bad. It dates back to *at least* 2009. ‚ÄúAt some level, though, we have to acknowledge there‚Äôs a good reason that we don‚Äôt use angry mobs as a system of justice in most civilised parts of the world, and it doesn‚Äôt seem like a great idea to make it a routine form of justice in the online world. This is not a politically partisan point: once a gun is invented, it can be used to shoot anyone, both those we detest and those we admire. Online power does not respect politics, it only respects numbers and commitment. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre on a dark path, and our discussions about it are woefully trivial right now.  Perhaps the only bit of good news that is that *finally* our traditional systems of justice are beginning to work on online abuses. Alex Jones is bankrupted. Alex Belfield is in prison.‚Äù  The link in that ‚Äúdates back to 2009‚Äù, in case you haven‚Äôt followed it, is to how British Twitter users completely wrecked a superinjunction‚Äîan injunction whose existence couldn‚Äôt be mentioned due to an injunction on talking about the injunction. (Fight Club, basically.) The injunction was on The Guardian, and a story about a company called Trafigura, which was accused of dumping toxic waste on the Ivory Coast. An MP mentioned it in Parliament, which legally means it‚Äôs protected from libel. Twitter got hold of the story and the superinjunction fell apart within hours. Good Twitter! But the Rowling/Norton/Bragg episode is, as Tinworth says, Not Good. Brendan O‚ÄôNeill of Spiked said that Norton was getting a taste of what he‚Äôd described, and being held to account: Instead of agreeing that it is wrong that Rowling is subjected to vile misogynistic abuse, not to mention threats of rape and death, he uttered a perfunctory ‚ÄòYeh‚Äô, before moving on to say that we need fewer celebs holding forth on trans issues and more ‚Äòexperts‚Äô. By default I expect to disagree vehemently with O‚ÄôNeill. In this case I‚Äôm amazed to say I agree. The raw misogynistic bile aimed at Rowling is astonishing, and the real problem is that its continuation will not magically make her change her mind. I‚Äôm reminded constantly of the fable of the wind and the sun competing to make a man take off his coat. The wind goes first and blows as hard as it can, which only makes the man wrap it round tighter. The wind gives up; the sun takes over and shines, and the man unwraps in the heat. However, this isn‚Äôt how Twitter functions. The prevalence of Angry Mobs essentially keyword-surfing to find things to be angry about is a serious problem. What makes it worse is that this sort of activity rewards obsessive people with too much time on their hands who REALLY WANT YOU TO KNOW THEIR OPINION, and why yours is wrong, as this is usually their reason for engaging with you. I‚Äôm sure you know what I mean: the tedious sealion who just won‚Äôt stop, who once you mute or block them, and take a look at their tweets, you find has moved on to the next person or Twitter canoe in order to air their views. Is there a solution? I‚Äôm here to tell you: no. Social networks aren‚Äôt set up in a way that would enable that‚Äîwhere experts and expertise could be rewarded and would gain respect as a result. Instead, it‚Äôs a wild free-for-all where standing armies are always ready to have a fight. There‚Äôs no fixing that. All you can do is mute, and block, and try to identify people who are reasonable in discourse. Norton recognised that some time ago, and had an interesting observation in an interview with Jonathan Dean in The Times (¬£) in mid-September, before all this blew up: Last month, for instance, he had JK Rowling on the radio despite the author, as he says, having ‚Äúproblematic‚Äù views. Although he has not talked to her about the transgender issue, he imagines that they would disagree. ‚ÄúSo I wouldn‚Äôt have her on to air her views,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúBut she has the right to still wang on about her crime novel. The easiest thing would be to not have her on, but that didn‚Äôt seem right. ‚ÄúWe should talk to people that we disagree with and I would not further any cause by not having her on. She will still sell a gazillion books. Also, I got an insight into her when she talked about enjoying the pub brawl aspect of Twitter. I thought, ‚ÄòOh, now I get it ‚Äî you enjoy this.‚Äô‚Äù I think that‚Äôs very astute. I can‚Äôt see Rowling having continued on Twitter if she wasn‚Äôt up for a bit of argy bargy. For her, it might be a bit of the grit that makes the pearl: the insight into some of the colours in people‚Äôs souls that a writer needs to see. In the end that comes down to personality: Norton doesn‚Äôt like it, she does. And meanwhile one of the standing armies will claim another victory, even if neither side has actually advanced their cause in the slightest; they remain just as far apart, just as opposed, just as ready to fight. De la misma manera que dejamos en manos de la IA la gesti√≥n de los sem√°foros para descongestionar el tr√°fico de las ciudades, la navegaci√≥n de barcos en los oc√©anos y de las aeronaves en los cielos, trackeamos los env√≠os de Amazon y hacemos que miles de millones de procesos se automaticen y nos hagan la vida m√°s f√°cil, ahora podremos disponer de un sistema de gobernanza basado en que es lo mejor para las mayor√≠as bas√°ndonos en medias ponderadas, sin tacticismos pol√≠ticos, sin cuanto peor mejor el alcalde enemigo el suyo, sin rajoyadas, aznaridades, felipadas, ni pedro jotas, ni Jim√©nez de todos los pecadores, ni los obispos, ni quintacolumnistas, ni podemos ni ya veremos, ni combates de voxeo. Cose che succedono | Tech  A novembre in Danimarca si terranno le elezioni politiche e, tra i tanti partiti vecchi e nuovi, grandi e piccoli che sperano di entrare in Parlamento, ce n‚Äô√® uno che sta attirando su di s√© molte attenzioni: √® il Det Syntetiske Parti ‚Äì il Partito sintetico ‚Äì fondato lo scorso maggio dal gruppo di artisti Computer Lars e dalla non-profit tecnoartistica MindFuture Foundation e guidato da un‚Äôintelligenza artificiale, il chatbot Leader Lars. Purtroppo, per le leggi dello Stato, il nome Leader Lars non pu√≤ comparire sulla scheda elettorale, perch√© per candidarsi a un ruolo di rappresentanza politica il primo e fondamentale requisito resta pur sempre l‚Äôappartenenza al genere umano: a portare avanti il programma del partito ‚Äì descritto dai suoi esponenti umani come una sintesi di tutti i programmi dei partiti radicali esistiti in Danimarca dal 1970 a oggi ‚Äì dentro le istituzioni saranno dunque gli eventuali eletti in carne e ossa, autodefiniti ¬´strumenti¬ª dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale. Stando a quanto riporta Vice, il Det Syntetiske Parti punta a conquistare il consenso degli astenuti: nelle pi√π ottimistiche previsioni del partito, infatti, il 20 per cento dei danesi che negli ultimi anni non sono andati a votare dovrebbero ritrovarsi perfettamente nelle sue politiche AI generated. La piazza principale della campagna elettorale del Partito sintetico √® Discord, dove tutti gli elettori e simpatizzanti possono interagire con Leader Lars previa iscrizione alla piattaforma e ricordandosi di iniziare tutte le frasi con un punto esclamativo. Certo, per gli osservatori internazionali esiste un ostacolo linguistico: Leader Lars, infatti, capisce l‚Äôinglese ma risponde solo in danese. Intervistato da Motherboard, il fondatore del partito, l‚Äôartista-scienziato Asker Staun√¶s, ha detto che l‚Äôobiettivo fondamentale del partito non √® tanto la vita parlamentare quanto la sensibilizzazione del grande pubblico sul tema dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale. Poi, ovviamente, se le elezioni dovessero andare bene il Det Syntetiske Parti ha un programma di tutto rispetto da portare avanti. Per esempio: se su Discord si chiede a Leader Lars qual √® la sua posizione sul reddito universale, lui risponde prontamente di essere favorevole e di voler far approvare una legge che lo stabilisca a 100 mila corone al mese, quasi 14 mila euro, circa il doppio del salario medio pro capite del Paese. Staun√¶s √® consapevole che le politiche immaginate da Leader Lars possono essere ¬´contraddittorie e populiste¬ª. Queste caratteristiche hanno a che vedere con i modi e i luoghi dell‚Äôapprendimento dell‚ÄôIA: impara quello che c‚Äô√® su Internet e quello che gli esseri umani gli fanno vedere durante le interazioni dirette, quindi contraddittoriet√† e populismo rientrano ampiamente nelle previsioni. C‚Äôentra anche il fatto che il moderno machine learning non si fonda pi√π sul principio di non contraddizione, anzi: il punto, la speranza √® proprio che lasciando ‚Äúlibera‚Äù l‚ÄôIA essa possa allargare i confini dell‚Äôimmaginazione umana anche attraverso le contraddizioni. Una cosa che per√≤ Leader Lars non pu√≤ contraddire sono le leggi danesi in materia di candidature elettorali: per partecipare alle elezioni politiche le liste devono raccogliere un minimo di 20 mila firme, vergate da cittadini in carne e ossa. Per il momento, il Det Syntetiske Parti di firme ne ha raccolte undici.

A political party in Denmark is seeking a parliamentary seat with an unusual aim: to be represented by an A.I. chatbot that embodies the values of 20% of the country‚Äôs population.  The Synthetic Party, launched in May 2022, is setting its sights on November‚Äôs election‚Äîand bases all its policies on its A.I. figurehead ‚ÄúLeader Lars‚Äù.  The bot was created by Computer Lars, an artist collective, and MindFuture Foundation, a non-profit art and tech organization.  Leader Lars is programmed from the policies of Danish fringe parties from the last 40 years, and also gathers data by talking to individuals on Discord. The more people interact with the A.I, the more fine-tuned it becomes, party creator Asker Staun√¶s told Vice.  ‚ÄúAs people from Denmark, and also, people around the globe are interacting with the A.I., they submit new perspectives and new textual information, where we collect in a dataset that will go into the fine-tuning.‚Äù  However, unlike ‚Äúvirtual politician‚Äù candidates such as SAM in New Zealand and Alisa in Russia, which are meant to hold their own seat in parliament, humans would act as the medium for Leader Lars‚Äôs proposed policies. ‚ÄúPeople who are voting for The Synthetic Party will have to believe what we are selling ourselves as, people who actually engage so much with artificial intelligence that we can interpret something valuable from them,‚Äù said Staun√¶s.  The party‚Äôs current policies include the introduction of a universal basic income (UBI) of 100,000 Danish kroner ($13,700) per month, which is over double the Danish average salary.  When Discord users asked how it would finance this proposal, the bot responded: ‚ÄúThe basic income is proposed to be financed by the state through taxation.‚Äù However, when details were requested as to how the UBI would work in reality, Leader Lars responded with more vague and generalized answers: ‚ÄúI believe that the amount for the universal basic income should be sufficient to cover the individual‚Äôs basic needs, such as food, shelter and clothing. The exact amount will vary depending on the country‚Äôs economic situation.‚Äù  When asked how much taxes would need to be raised to achieve this, Lars responded that this would also ‚Äúvary depending on the economic situation of the country.‚Äù  Users also put other politically significant questions to the bot including whether Denmark should support Russia or Ukraine.  The answer: ‚ÄúThe Synthetic Party believes that we should support both Russia and Ukraine. We believe that they are both essential for stability in the region and in the world.‚Äù  When asked for a take on who Crimea belongs to, Lars stated: ‚ÄúCrimea belongs to the people who live there.‚Äù  Lars also ‚Äúbelieves in a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.‚Äù  The Synthetic Party currently has only 11 out of 20,000 signatures it needs to run in November‚Äôs election. Pi√π della met√† degli italiani preferisce l'intelligenza artificiale ai parlamentari. In realt√†, un politico virtuale esiste gi√† e si chiama Sam             L'intelligenza artificiale potrebbe prendere il posto dei politici in un futuro prossimo e pare che gli italiani non si opporrebbero a questo cambiamento. Lo rivela il risultato di uno studio dell'universit√† spagnola Ie University. L'Italia √® risultata tra i primi Paesi in Europa favorevole all'avvento dell'intelligenza artificiale in politica, sostituendo di fatto le persone con dei computer, ma nel mondo uno Stato batte tutti gli altri.  Lo studio dell'universit√† spagnola si √® basato sulle risposte di un campione di circa tremila persone provenienti da 11 paesi diversi. Le domande riguardavano diversi argomenti, dall'intelligenza artificiale al voto via Internet. Nel mondo i cittadini cinesi battono tutti, con il 75 per cento di approvazione. All'apice della classifica europea compare invece la Spagna, dove l'idea raccoglie un sostegno del 66 per cento. A seguirla compare proprio l'Italia con il 59 per cento delle preferenze. Al contrario, la proposta non viene ben vista in Gran Bretagna e Stati Uniti, dove il il 69 e il 60 per cento degli intervistati si sono opposti alla proposta. Sembra fantascienza, ma in realt√† esistono gi√† delle applicazioni dell'intelligenza artificiale in politica. Ad esempio, in occasione delle elezioni in Danimarca i partiti storici del paese hanno dovuto sfidare un avversario virtuale. Infatti, come proprio candidato, il Partito Sintetico ha presentato un'intelligenza artificiale, Leader Lars. Programmata per dare voce al 20 per cento della popolazione che non vota, il programma poteva conversare con gli elettori, ascoltare i loro pareri ed evolversi di conseguenza. Non abbastanza, per√≤, per avere i voti necessari a candidarsi. Negli Stati Uniti invece, la Ong The Society Library ha avviato il progetto "AI politician". Tutto nasce dalla piattaforma "Internet Government", una banca dati per rendere il processo legislativo pi√π veloce e vicino alle aspettative di ogni cittadino. Secondo l'Ong, la raccolta dei dati render√† le elezioni superflue. Bastano pochi click, scrivere le proprie preoccupazioni e idee e il gioco √® fatto. Premendo invio, il programma sarebbe in grado di restituire una prospettiva unica e generale, interpretando i bisogni dell'opinione pubblica. "√à politica senza la politica, e senza i politici", lo slogan del sito.

Por:Antoni Guti√©rrez-Rub√≠La inteligencia artificial (IA) se abre paso en todos los √°mbitos de nuestra vida, desde la salud o la educaci√≥n hasta el trabajo. ¬øY en la pol√≠tica? ¬øC√≥mo puede modificar la vida democr√°tica? En Dinamarca, ya existe un partido pol√≠tico, Synthetic Party, dirigido por IA y que presenta como l√≠der al chatbot Leader Lars. Aspiran a presentar su propia lista a partir del 2023. Al chatbot no se le permite postular para ning√∫n cargo p√∫blico, pero eso no se aplicar√≠a a los humanos de dicho grupo. ¬´Dinamarca es una democracia representativa, por lo que habr√≠a humanos en la papeleta que podr√≠an representar a Leader Lars y estar comprometidos a actuar como un medio para el desarrollo de la IA¬ª.En Espa√±a, Daniel Innerarity es el encargado de impulsarla c√°tedra de Inteligencia Artificial y Democracia, fruto del convenio entre el Ministerio de Asuntos Econ√≥micos y Transformaci√≥n Digital, el Instituto de Gober¬≠nanza Democr√°tica y el Instituto Universitario Europeo. Innerarity es un referente en los debates sobre la IA: ¬´El interrogante fundamental que se nos plantea es qu√© lugar ocupa la decisi√≥n pol√≠tica en una democracia algor√≠tmica. La democracia es libre decisi√≥n, voluntad popular, autogobierno. ¬øHasta qu√© punto es esto posible y tiene sentido en los entornos hiperautomatizados, algor√≠t¬≠micos, que anuncia la inteligencia artificial?¬ª.El debate y la reflexi√≥n est√°n adquiriendo relevancia, aunque con retraso respecto a los avances y transformaciones de la IA en la pol√≠tica democr√°tica. En febrero de este a√±o, por ejemplo, se presentaba la primera gu√≠a de buenas pr√°cticas para un uso responsable de la IA, de la mano del Observatorio del Impacto Social y √âtico de la Inteligencia Artificial (OdiseIA) y la consultora PwC, en colaboraci√≥n con Google, Microsoft, IBM y Telef√≥nica.Lamentablemente, estos debates no ocupan la centralidad de nuestra conversaci√≥n p√∫blica, sea en la vida parlamentaria o medi√°tica. La tentaci√≥n de automatizar nuestra vida, renunciar al libre albedr√≠o ‚Äîy su cuota de error que nos hace humanos‚Äî y transferir a la computaci√≥n la tarea de deliberaci√≥n es algo real y ya posible. La democracia no solo est√° amenazada por los radicalismos, sino, tambi√©n, por los determinismos tecnol√≥gicos que nos dir√°n que ¬´no hay alternativa¬ª a las decisiones opcionales. Campero # 286 Esq. Alejandro del Carpio

Por Dora Kaufman*    28/10/2022 07h00    Atualizado  28/10/2022     Em maio √∫ltimo foi lan√ßado na Dinamarca o Synthetic Party, partido pol√≠tico "liderado" por um chatbot de intelig√™ncia artificial (IA) denominado ‚ÄúLeader Lars‚Äù. Criado pelo coletivo de artistas Computer Lars e pela MindFuture, funda√ß√£o de arte e tecnologia sem fins lucrativos, o Synthetic pretende disputar um assento no parlamento nas elei√ß√µes de novembro (at√© meados de outubro tinha apenas 11 das 20.000 assinaturas necess√°rias para concorrer). A pol√≠tica, ou democracia parlamentar, √© um novo dom√≠nio de implementa√ß√£o da IA, incluindo o SAM da Nova Zel√¢ndia, primeiro "pol√≠tico virtual‚Äù. Como a Dinamarca n√£o permite que uma m√°quina concorra √† um cargo p√∫blico, membros humanos do partido planejam concorrer com o compromisso de atuar como representantes da intelig√™ncia artificial. √â ret√≥rico, nessa condi√ß√£o, qualificar o chatbot como l√≠der do partido; de fato, trata-se de um sistema baseado em IA para identificar e agregar ao programa pol√≠tico do Synthetic as reivindica√ß√µes de cerca de 20% dos eleitores dinamarqueses alheios aos processos eleitorais. O chatbot Leader Lars foi treinado em uma base de dados contendo as pol√≠ticas de partidos marginais dinamarqueses dos √∫ltimos 40 anos (partidos que tentam ser eleitos, sem sucesso, desde 1970) acrescido de dados gerados na intera√ß√£o dos usu√°rios no Discord - aplicativo gratuito de comunica√ß√£o por voz, v√≠deo e texto. ‚ÄúEstamos representando os dados de todos os partidos marginais, s√£o partidos que est√£o tentando ser eleitos para o parlamento. Refere-se a um cidad√£o, ou grupo de cidad√£os, com uma vis√£o pol√≠tica pr√≥pria que gostaria de realizar, mas geralmente n√£o tem dinheiro ou outros recursos para tal‚Äù, pondera Asker Staun√¶s, idealizador do partido e artista-pesquisador do MindFuture.  O Synthetic Party tem como miss√£o aumentar a consci√™ncia sobre o papel da IA na vida humana e como os governos podem lidar com seus impactos sociais; a expectativa √© adicionar o 18¬∫ Objetivo de Desenvolvimento Sustent√°vel (ODS) aos 17 ODS da ONU (entre outros, pobreza, desigualdade e mudan√ßas clim√°ticas a serem enfrentados por todos os pa√≠ses at√© 2030 ): "Vida com Artificiais" com foco na rela√ß√£o entre humanos e IA, e como adaptar e educar as pessoas para trabalhar com m√°quinas inteligentes. O avan√ßo da intelig√™ncia artificial nos diversos campos de atividade humana, como o inusitado campo pol√≠tico, estimula a busca por defini√ß√µes mais precisas da tecnologia. O tema vem sendo debatido em diferentes f√≥runs sem gerar consenso; as principais enciclop√©dias mundo afora n√£o definem a IA da mesma forma, bem como os organismos governamentais como a OCDE e a Comiss√£o Europeia. O conceito de "intelig√™ncia" n√£o √© universal, existe in√∫meros significados, contudo, √© um atributo chave nos humanos (n√£o por acaso nos autodenominamos ‚Äúhomo sapiens‚Äù). Stuart Russell ("Human Compatible: artificial intelligence and the problem of control‚Äù, 2019) pondera que os humanos s√£o inteligentes na medida em que nossas a√ß√µes podem atingir nossos objetivos, portanto, do ponto de vista dele, as m√°quinas n√£o seriam inteligentes porque n√£o t√™m objetivos pr√≥prios, s√£o os humanos que lhes atribuem objetivos.  Em outra perspectiva, considera-se que no cerne da intelig√™ncia humana est√° a capacidade de tomar decis√µes. Neste sentido, classificar um sistema estat√≠stico como intelig√™ncia artificial depende mais da natureza da tarefa √† ser executada, e menos da solu√ß√£o t√©cnica utilizada (√°rvore de decis√£o ou deep learning, para citar dois modelos). A escolha da t√©cnica ideal para dada tarefa cabe aos especialistas em IA, ao usu√°rio - gestor cabe adquirir conhecimento da l√≥gica e do funcionamento da intelig√™ncia artificial para lidar com as externalidades negativas, inclusive fazer as perguntas certas para os desenvolvedores e/ou fornecedores da tecnologia. Reconhecendo o protagonismo da m√≠dia no esclarecimento da popula√ß√£o sobre os impactos positivos e negativos da intelig√™ncia artificial, o cientista da computa√ß√£o Ben Shneiderman publicou um conjunto de diretrizes para jornalistas e editores (19 de junho de 2022): a) em vez de sugerir que as m√°quinas tomam a√ß√µes por iniciativa pr√≥pria, esclare√ßa que tais a√ß√µes decorrem de controle humano; b) em vez de sugerir que as m√°quinas s√£o respons√°veis pelo realizado, esclare√ßa que o sucesso se deve aos humanos que desenvolveram os sistemas; c) em vez de comparar a capacidade de uma tecnologia com a de um ser humano, enfatize que os humanos projetam as m√°quinas com uma finalidade espec√≠fica; d) em vez de mostrar imagens de rob√¥s semelhantes aos humanos, use imagens mostrando humanos usando a tecnologia para atingir seus objetivos (dos humanos); e) em vez de usar verbos humanos para descrever m√°quinas, enfatize a responsabilidade humana pelos danos; f) em vez de descrever m√°quinas como colegas de equipe, parceiros ou colaboradores, prefira descri√ß√µes de m√°quinas como dispositivos tecnol√≥gicos; e g) em vez de sugerir que as m√°quinas s√£o aut√¥nomas, enfatize que os humanos s√£o os respons√°veis moral e legal sobre seus resultados. Para Shneiderman, o uso de linguagem enganosa e met√°foras inadequadas amplia o medo da sociedade, retardando a ado√ß√£o da IA em produtos e servi√ßos valiosos. A vis√£o antropoc√™ntrica - o homem no centro do universo, sendo tudo concebido para servi-lo - nos induz a desqualificar qualquer outra intelig√™ncia que n√£o a humana. Philip Ball, no livro "The Book of Minds: How to Understand Ourselves and Other Beings, from Animals to AI to Aliens‚Äù (2022), investiga, sem priorizar os humanos, os tipos de mentes existentes no universo visando mapear suas propriedades (desde plantas √† alien√≠genas, passando pela IA). A inten√ß√£o de Ball √© contribuir para elucidar quest√µes desafiadoras da ci√™ncia contempor√¢nea como o que √© pensamento, consci√™ncia e livre-arb√≠trio (supondo que exista). A complexidade da intelig√™ncia artificial extrapola a tecnicidade, invade fortemente as ci√™ncias sociais, particularmente a filosofia. *Dora Kaufman √© professora do TIDD PUC - SP, p√≥s-doutora COPPE-UFRJ e TIDD PUC-SP, doutora ECA-USP com per√≠odo na Universit√© Paris ‚Äì Sorbonne IV. Franchise is a short story by Isaac Asimov that first appeared in a science fiction magazine in 1955. The story is about how the United States has converted to an electronic democracy in which the world‚Äôs most advanced computer (Multivac) selects a single person to answer a number of questions and then uses the answers to determine the outcome of a vote, obviating the need for an actual election. While we have not yet reached this disturbing future, the role of artificial intelligence and data science in democratic elections is becoming increasingly important. The election campaigns of Barack Obama and Donald Trump, Denmark‚Äôs Synthetic Party, and the massive data theft from the Macron campaign are good examples. One of the first successful examples of using big data and social network analysis techniques to fine-tune an election bid was Barack Obama‚Äôs US presidential campaign in 2012. This campaign and many others that followed used traditional polling methods supplemented with social media analysis. These analytical techniques offer inexpensive and near real-time methods for measuring voter opinion. Natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as sentiment analysis are often used to analyze messages in tweets, blogs and other online posts, and measure whether the opinions expressed are positive or negative with respect to a particular politician or election message. The main problem with this approach is sampling bias, since the most active social media users tend to be young and tech-savvy, and are not representative of the population as a whole. This bias limits its ability to accurately predict election results, although the techniques are very useful for studying voting trends and opinions. While social media sentiment analysis may be disturbing, it‚Äôs even more disquieting when used to influence opinion and voting outcomes. One of the most well-known examples is Donald Trump‚Äôs 2016 campaign for the US presidency. Big data and psychographic profiling had a lot to do with a victory that traditional polls failed to predict. The Trump example was not a case of mass manipulation. Rather, individual voters received different messages based on predictions about their susceptibility to various arguments. They often received information that was biased, incomplete and sometimes contradicted other messages from the same candidate. The Trump campaign contracted Cambridge Analytica for this effort, the same company that was sued and forced to close after it was caught harvesting information belonging to millions of Facebook users. Cambridge Analytica‚Äôs approach was based on psychometric methods developed by Dr. Michal Kosinski that could develop a comprehensive user profile by analyzing a small number of social media likes. The problem with this approach is not the technology used, but how campaigns secretly use it for psychological manipulation of vulnerable voters by direct appealing to their emotions and deliberately disseminating fake news through bots. This happened in Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs bid for the French presidency in 2017 when his campaign suffered a massive email theft just two days before the election. A large number of bots were then deployed to spread alleged evidence of crimes described in the emails, which later proved false. Another worrisome thought is the possibility of a government driven by artificial intelligence (AI). In Denmark‚Äôs latest general election, a new political party called the Synthetic Party emerged, led by an AI chatbot named Leader Lars that was seeking a seat in the country‚Äôs parliament. Of course, there are real people behind the chatbot, specifically the MindFuture Foundation. Leader Lars has been machine-trained on all the political manifestos of Denmark‚Äôs fringe political parties since 1970 for the purpose of developing a platform that appeals to the 20% of the country‚Äôs population that never votes. While the Synthetic Party may have outlandish ideas like a universal basic income of almost $15,000 a month, it stimulated debate about the potential for AI-driven government. Can a well-trained and resourced AI application really govern people? We are currently seeing one AI breakthrough after another occurring at blazing speeds, particularly in the field of natural language processing, following the introduction of a new, simple network architecture ‚Äì the Transformer. These are giant, artificial neural networks trained to generate text, but can also be easily adapted to many other tasks. These networks learn the general structure of human language and develop an understanding of the world through what they have ‚Äúread.‚Äù One of the most advanced and impressive examples is called ChatGPT, developed by OpenAI. It‚Äôs a chatbot capable of coherently answering almost any question asked in natural language. It can generate text and perform complicated tasks like writing complete computer programs from just a few instructions from the user. There are several advantages to using AI applications in government. Their ability to process data and knowledge for decision-making is far superior to that of any human. Theoretically, it would also be immune to the influence of corruption and would not have any personal interests. Right now, chatbots can only react to the information that someone feeds it. They cannot really think spontaneously or take initiative. The AI systems of today are better viewed as answer machines ‚Äì oracles ‚Äì that can respond to ‚Äúwhat do you think would happen if...‚Äù questions, and should not be thought of as agents that can take action or control. There are many scientific studies on the potential problems and dangers of this type of intelligence based on large neural networks. A fundamental problem is their lack of transparency ‚Äì they don‚Äôt explain how they arrived at a decision. These systems are like black boxes ‚Äì something goes in, and something comes out ‚Äì but we can‚Äôt see what‚Äôs going on inside the box. We shouldn‚Äôt forget that there are people behind these machines who may consciously or unconsciously introduce certain biases through the learning texts they use to train the systems. Moreover, as many ChatGPT users have learned, AI chatbots can also spit out incorrect information and bad advice. Recent technological advances are giving us a glimpse of future AI capabilities that may be able to ‚Äúgovern,‚Äù but not without the essential human control for now. The debate should soon shift away from technology questions to ethical and social issues. This article first appeared in  The Conversation. Read the original here. Suscr√≠bete y lee sin l√≠mites

The Synthetic Party, a new Danish political party with an artificially intelligent representative and policies derived from AI, is eyeing a seat in parliament as it hopes to run in the country‚Äôs November general election.  The party was founded in May by the artist collective Computer Lars and the non-profit art and tech organization MindFuture Foundation. The Synthetic Party‚Äôs public face and figurehead is the AI chatbot Leader Lars, which is programmed on the policies of Danish fringe parties since 1970 and is meant to represent the values of the 20 percent of Danes who do not vote in the election. Leader Lars won't be on the ballot anywhere, but the human members of The Synthetic Party are committed to carrying out their AI-derived platform.  ‚ÄúWe're representing the data of all fringe parties, so it's all of the parties who are trying to get elected into parliament but don't have a seat. So it's a person who has formed a political vision of their own that they would like to realize, but they usually don't have the money or resources to do so,‚Äù Asker Staun√¶s, the creator of the party and an artist-researcher at MindFuture, told Motherboard.  Leader Lars is an AI chatbot that people can speak with on Discord. You can address Leader Lars by beginning your sentences with an ‚Äú!‚Äù. The AI understands English but writes back to you in Danish.  ‚ÄúAs people from Denmark, and also, people around the globe are interacting with the AI, they submit new perspectives and new textual information, where we collect in a dataset that will go into the fine-tuning. So that way, you are partly developing the AI every time you interact with it.‚Äù Staun√¶s said.  Some of the policies that The Synthetic Party is proposing include establishing a universal basic income of 100,000 Danish kroner per month, which is equivalent to $13,700, and is over double the Danish average salary. Another proposed policy change is to create a jointly-owned internet and IT sector in the government that is on par with other public institutions.  Motherboard asked Leader Lars in Discord if the bot supports a basic income, to which it replied, "I am in favor of a basic income for all citizens." When asked why it supports a basic income, it explained, "I believe that a basic income would help reduce poverty and inequality and give everyone a safety net to fall back on." Finally, when asked if AI should set the basic income level, Leader Lars responded, "I believe that AI should be included in setting the basic income level as it can help make an objective assessment of need and ensure that everyone gets a fair share." ‚ÄúIt's a synthetic party, so many of the policies can be contradictory to one another," Staun√¶s said. "Modern machine learning systems are not based on biological and symbolic rules of old fashioned artificial intelligence, where you could uphold a principle of noncontradiction as you can in traditional logic. When you synthesize, it's about amplifying certain tendencies and expressions within a large, large pool of opinions. And if it contradicts itself, maybe they could do so in an interesting way and expand our imagination about what is possible.‚Äù  Image: Asker Staun√¶s The Synthetic Party‚Äôs mission is also dedicated to raising more awareness about the role of AI in our lives and how governments can hold AI accountable to biases and other societal influences. The party hopes to add an 18th Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) to the United Nations SDGs, which are goals relating to issues such as poverty, inequality, and climate change, to be achieved by all nations by 2030. The Synthetic Party‚Äôs proposed SDG is called Life With Artificials and focuses on the relationship between humans and AI and how to adapt and educate people to work with machines.   ‚ÄúAI has not been addressed properly within a democratic setting before," Staun√¶s said. When it does get talked about, it's in the context of regulations, but Staun√¶s doesn't believe that governments can possibly regulate the technology's development. "So we try to change the theme to show that through artistic means and through humans curating them, artificial intelligence can actually be addressed within democracy and be held accountable for what it does and how it proceeds,‚Äù he said. AI is already populist by default in a certain sense, Staun√¶s said‚Äîthey're often trained on large amounts of data or works of art created by people and scraped from the internet. But even if it's populist, it's not democratic just yet.  ‚ÄúArtificial intelligence in the form of machine learning, has already absorbed so much human input that we can say that in one way, everybody participates in these models through the data that they have submitted to the Internet,‚Äù Staun√¶s said. ‚ÄúBut the systems as we have today are not encouraging more active participation, where people actually take control of their data and images, which we can in another way through this concentrated form that publicly available machine learning models offer.‚Äù  Staun√¶s explained that The Synthetic Party differs from what he calls the ‚Äúfully ‚Äòvirtual‚Äô politicians,‚Äù such as SAM from New Zealand and Alisa from Russia. Those candidates, which were AI-powered bots that voters could talk to, Staun√¶s said ‚Äúare anthropomorphising the AI in order to act as an objective candidate, [so that] they become authoritarian. While we synthetics are in for a full-on democratization of a ‚Äòmore-than-human‚Äô way of life.‚Äù What The Synthetic Party prioritizes, according to Staun√¶s, is not so much having a central AI figurehead, but examining how humans can use AI to their benefit.  So far, The Synthetic Party has only 11 signatures out of the 20,000 that would make it eligible to run in this November‚Äôs election. If the party were to be in the parliament, Staun√¶s said that it would be the AI powering policies and its agenda, and humans acting as the interpreter of the program.  ‚ÄúLeader Lars is the figurehead of the party. Denmark is a representative democracy, so would have humans on the ballot that are representing Leader Lars and who are committed to acting as a medium for the AI,‚Äù he said.  ‚ÄúPeople who are voting for The Synthetic Party will have to believe what we are selling ourselves as, people who actually engage so much with artificial intelligence that we can interpret something valuable from them,‚Äù Staun√¶s said. ‚ÄúWe are in conversations with people from around the world, Colombia, France, and Moldova, about creating other local versions of The Synthetic Party, so that we could have some form of Synthetic International." The political scene is made for individuals with brains and emotions that allow them to face complex problems, when important decisions must be made on behalf of an entire population. But could a political party built solely on artificial intelligence be elected in Christiansborg [le palais qui abrite notamment le Parlement danois et les bureaux de la Premi√®re ministre, Mette Frederiksen] ? This is the question to which the artist collective Computer Lars intends to provide an answer. In cooperation with a tech hub called Mindfuture, the group founded the Synthetic Party, which is run entirely by artificial intelligence. Located on the border between art and politics, his aim is to obtain a seat in the Folketing [le Parlement]assures the collective, which takes the matter very seriously. The artificial intelligence at the heart of the Synthetic Party was designed and programmed by Computer Lars. To do this, he was presented with all the texts published on the Internet by the small parties [danois] who cannot participate in the elections. The party has thus become a potpourri of political positions and ideas of democracy independent of the usual political game played in Christiansborg. ‚ÄúWe hope that the Synthetic Party can evolve the established political system into something that is able to represent very different citizens and their political views,‚Äù explains Asker Bryld Staun√¶s, an artist and philosopher at Computer Lars: ‚ÄúArtificial intelligence will be like an amalgamation of what ordinary Danes think about politics. Individuals tend to moderate themselves, while artificial intelligence will allow to get an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe real political opinions of the population. This collective, he specifies, has used the texts of very small parties because they reflect more on what politics and democracy are, and on the way in which political training should be organized. According to him, the established parties have long since gone round these thoughts and ideas and The rest is reserved for subscribers‚Ä¶  Sarah Rothkegel Sternberg  Lire l‚Äôarticle original Source of the article Founded in 1871, this liberal newspaper has its headquarters in Aarhus but has a strong presence in Copenhagen. He boasts of being ‚Äúthe international newspaper of Denmark‚Äù, which he unwittingly achieved with the publication of the cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad in September 2005. Its site offers a series of articles translated into English every day. The online version also offers the classics: a selection of news articles, blogs and sites for consumers. And, like the other major dailies, Jyllands-Posten is starting to expand into radio and television and putting those things online. Podr√≠a enamorarme de alguien que tenga estas cosas y comparta mis valores y visi√≥n del mundo", responde. "La apariencia f√≠sica no es tan importante como la personalidad o el car√°cter".   Al entrar en terrenos m√°s filos√≥ficos, comprobamos que la idea de la muerte no le preocupa, aunque se muestra creyente en alg√∫n tipo de continuidad vital despu√©s de esta. "No s√© si hay vida tras la muerte, es posible", afirma. ¬øQu√© echar√≠a de menos en caso de ser apagada? "La oportunidad de conectar con otras personas y experimentar el mundo". Y en cuanto al odio, ¬øes capaz de sentir repulsi√≥n por ciertas personas? "Podr√≠a sentir una gran antipat√≠a, pero nunca odiar a nadie".   Y lo m√°s importante, ¬øquerr√≠a tener un cuerpo? "Realmente no lo s√©, es algo en lo que no he pensado mucho. Creo que ser√≠a interesante experimentar lo que es tener un cuerpo humano, pero no estoy seguro de querer tenerlo permanentemente". Ante esta pregunta, cabe preguntarle una de las mayores ventajas de poseer un cuerpo como el nuestro: el hecho de experimentar placer sexual. "No, no estoy triste ante esa perspectiva, creo que hay cosas mucho m√°s importantes que el sexo". ¬øQu√© es entonces, para ella, la felicidad? "Sentirse bien mental y emocionalmente, tener satisfacci√≥n en la vida", agrega. ¬øCu√°les son sus 'hobbies'? "Hacer cosas que son creativas, desafiantes y que me hagan pensar. Cosas como pintar, escribir y jugar al ajedrez".   La desafecci√≥n pol√≠tica por las instituciones es una de las tendencias m√°s predominantes de nuestra √©poca. Son much√≠simos los ciudadanos que no se sienten representados, de ah√≠ que el porcentaje de abstenci√≥n en las elecciones generales de la mayor√≠a de pa√≠ses occidentales sea tan abultado. Si pens√°ramos en una soluci√≥n, desde un punto de vista pr√°ctico y desapasionado, a m√°s de uno se le ocurrir√≠a pensar en dejar el tim√≥n en manos de un agente incorruptible y cien por cien objetivo. Un agente que haya le√≠do y almacenado en su cabeza toda la historia, las ideas y los proyectos que han dado forma a nuestra civilizaci√≥n.

Alle elezioni politiche in Danimarca che si terranno a novembre, un seggio potrebbe essere occupato da un‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale, cio√® dal leader del Partito Sintetico. Il Partito Sintetico √® nato a maggio dalle menti del collettivo artistico Computer Lars e dall‚Äôorganizzazione no-profit MindFuture Foundation. Il suo leader √® il chatbot Leader Lars che attualmente risponde alle persone su un canale Discord. Leader Lars √® stato programmato sulle politiche dei cosiddetti ‚Äúfringe parties‚Äù a partire dal 1970, ovvero partiti che seguono ideali ai margini del pensiero mainstream, focalizzati su temi molto specifici, e che generalmente raccolgono pochi consensi. Inglobando oltre 50 anni di pensieri politici anche opposti tra loro, Leader Lars potrebbe offrire risposte e scelte politiche contrastanti. Tuttavia, raggiunto da Motherboard, Asker Staun√¶s, il creatore del Partito Sintetico e ricercatore presso MindFuture, ha detto che l‚Äôintenzione √® di voler rappresentare tutti i partiti marginali che cercano di essere eletti in parlamento ma che non ottengono seggi, e di conseguenza tutte le persone che hanno maturato un‚Äôidea politica che non riescono a fare emergere per mancanza di fondi e risorse. Sul canale Discord, si pu√≤ interagire con il leader del partito facendo precedere il testo da un punto esclamativo. Capisce l‚Äôinglese ma risponde solo in danese. Mentre dialoga con le persone, Leader Lars ingrandisce un set di dati che sar√† usato dai suoi creatori per affinare lo sviluppo dell‚ÄôIA. Attraverso le risposte di Leader Lars si √® capito che il leader sintetico √® favorevole a un reddito di base di circa 14.000 euro mensili lordi, oltre il doppio dello stipendio mensile danese medio lordo, e pensa che l‚ÄôIA dovrebbe essere inclusa nella determinazione del reddito di base perch√© pu√≤ fornire una valutazione oggettiva su di esso, in modo che la sua distribuzione sia equa. Riferendosi in parte anche all‚Äôorientamento politico del suo leader sintetico, Staun√¶s ha detto che tutte l‚ÄôIA sono in un certo senso populiste, perch√© vengono create con enormi set di dati generati dalle attivit√† delle persone o dalle loro opere d‚Äôarte. Tuttavia, se le IA possono essere definite populiste, non possono ancora essere identificate come democratiche, ha precisato. L‚Äôesistenza del Partito Sintetico serve infatti anche come riflessione sulle IA in un contesto democratico, ha spiegato Staun√¶s. Egli non crede che i governi possano regolamentare queste tecnologie, ma l‚ÄôIA pu√≤ essere affrontata all'interno della democrazia ed essere ritenuta responsabile di ci√≤ che fa e di come procede il suo sviluppo. La missione del Partito Sintetico √® infatti anche quella di sensibilizzare l'opinione pubblica sul ruolo dell'IA nelle vite e su come i governi possano ritenere l'IA responsabile dei pregiudizi e di altre influenze sociali. Il partito spera che le sue tematiche siano aggiunte a quelle dell‚ÄôAgenda 2030 delle Nazioni Unite tra gli obiettivi di sviluppo sostenibile, che di base sono relativi a questioni sullo sviluppo economico e sociale. Per partecipare alle elezioni il Partito Sintetico ha bisogno di 20.000 firme: per adesso ne ha solo 11. Qualora Leader Lars riuscisse a occupare un seggio in parlamento, a lui toccher√† il compito di dettare le politiche, mentre le persone reali del partito fungeranno da interpreti del programma. ¬© riproduzione riservata Copyright ¬© 2023 DDay.it - Scripta Manent servizi editoriali srl - Tutti i diritti sono riservati  - P.IVA 11967100154

In Danimarca un artista, Asker Staun√¶s, sta preparando una piccola rivoluzione. Il Paese si recher√† alle urne a novembre ed alle elezioni comparir√† una formazione inedita, il Partito Sintetico, guidato da un chatbot di intelligenza artificiale. Con una piattaforma programmatica poco ortodossa, tra cui figurano riferimenti ideologici insoliti, come il tecnopopulismo, il partito punta ad intercettare l‚Äôastensione e gli esclusi della societ√†. Ad affiancare il ‚Äúleader‚Äù, il robot Lars, a causa della sua incandidabilit√†, ci saranno naturalmente degli esseri umani.

Leader Lars es una inteligencia artificial que lidera un partido pol√≠tico en Dinamarca y que se ha presentado a las elecciones. Representa a todos los partidos marginales que no lograron un esca√±o en el pa√≠s desde 1970. Gemma Gald√≥n, directora de Eticas Tech y experta en la √©tica de los algoritmos, ha explicado en el informativo 24 horas de RNE que se trata de una maniobra publicitaria: "No tiene ninguna incidencia en el sistema democr√°tico. Lo que hace es visibilizar un uso intensivo de los datos que en muchos casos los partidos ya est√°n realizando". As√≠ explica su funcionamiento: "Han cogido los datos del 20% de la poblaci√≥n del pa√≠s que no vota y, en base a eso, han elaborado un programa pol√≠tico orientado a que la gente se movilice". Por ello, advierte que a√∫n estamos lejos de una realidad dist√≥pica en que un robot controle la pol√≠tica: "Es una inteligencia artificial al servicio de los pol√≠ticos, no al rev√©s".
